intro: Pavetta appendiculata, commonly known as the appendiculate pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals.
